name: APU_3_Pairing_or_Syncing_User_Accounts_with_Devices_and_Data_Repositories
title: APU.3 Pairing or Syncing User Accounts with Devices and Data Repositories (Header)
description: This category is about consumer verification of all devices to which they wish to pair or sync data.

statement.label: APU.3#77
statement.requirement: User has authenticated identity to an app and has an active session before pairing an external device to an app account.

statement.label: APU.3#78
statement.requirement: Before a device is paired with an app to collect information about a specific individual, the app displays a screen which asks the user to confirm that the device will collect information about a specific, named person. The person may be the account holder or a proxy subject of the account holder.

statement.label: APU.3#79
statement.requirement: The person who pairs a device with an individual in context of use of a specific app can un-pair the device and individual through an app utility function.

statement.label: APU.3#80
statement.requirement: Before a device is paired with an app to collect information about a specific individual, the app states what data will be collected by the device and how the device data is used. This statement may include a link to an informational page which provides details about data collection and use.

statement.label: APU.3#81
statement.requirement: [Data for more than one person can be collected by the app/device pair] The app asks the account holder to confirm the person for whom data will be collected by the device before data is collected and transmitted.

statement.label: APU.3#82
statement.requirement: [Developer includes a syncing option within APP (e.g., same app data synchronized across smartphone and tablet devices)] User is provided with option to consent with syncing process.[1]
